perturbation.original_text: Invoices are payable within 60 days of receipt, with the exception of payments due under Clause 19.2, which shall be payable on the due date or on acceptance of the work, which ever is the later.
perturbation.changed_text: Invoices are payable within 90 days of receipt, with the exception of payments due under Clause 19.2, which shall be payable on the due date or on acceptance of the work, which ever is the later.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment term for invoices to 90 days, potentially conflicting with prompt payment laws in some jurisdictions, which may require payment within a shorter timeframe (e.g., 30-60 days) to ensure fair and timely compensation for services rendered.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Prompt Payment Laws (various state and federal)

perturbation.original_text: Within 60 days of the end of each calendar month, HealthGate shall forward to Publishers the net Article Fees actually collected (exclusive of HealthGate's service fee).
perturbation.changed_text: Within 120 days of the end of each calendar month, HealthGate shall forward to Publishers the net Article Fees actually collected (exclusive of HealthGate's service fee).
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment timeframe to 120 days, which can be illegal according to several states' prompt payment laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Prompt Payment Laws (various state and federal)

perturbation.original_text: Upon receipt of written notice from the Publishers that HealthGate is in default under this Agreement by failing to comply with the requirements of this Clause 33, or that HealthGate is in default under any provision regarding rights upon termination of this Agreement, HealthGate shall have ten (10) business days in which to cure such default.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon receipt of written notice from the Publishers that HealthGate is in default under this Agreement by failing to comply with the requirements of this Clause 33, or that HealthGate is in default under any provision regarding rights upon termination of this Agreement, HealthGate shall have two (2) business days in which to cure such default.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period to two business days may be considered unreasonably short, potentially conflicting with principles of fairness and good faith in contract law, especially if the default requires a more extended period to remedy adequately.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Reasonableness and Good Faith Standards
